> 4) Are ghosts as ludicrously powerful in "army v. army" style play as 
> they are in "heroes v. army"?  As it currently stands, if a ghost 
> catches one of us in a corner, it's just escape, restart, because 
> there's no hope of ever getting unscared.  Seems foolish, so I can't 
> imagine it's that way if you play "properly."
When I used to play the game (too busy with school now) I remember that I did 
have to cycle through my chars. to get unfrozen, but also, later in my 
playing, I found out you could press in the same direction that the character 
is running scared.  I can't remember if you have to be running then push the 
direction you're running in or you have to be running against a 
wall/tree/rock/etc.

> 7) What exactly do the various stats do?  Especially dexterity, which 
> doesn't seem to change walking speed very much; the others have 
> their "obvious" effects -- more MP, more HP, less damage taken, more 
> damage inflicted -- but does intelligence effect spells?  Etc.
Intelligence:  I think this increases the speed your MP restores (in certain 
cases somehow I thought that it also increased potency, not sure now though)
Dexterity:  This increases the speed your HP restores.
 
> 2) Is there any way to patch the game to add new classes, or to make 
> the classes more interesting?  Right now, the Mage is really the only 
> one who gets increasingly complex as you level up.
There isn't a way... yet.  However, what you can play around with are the 
graphics with the "editor.exe" file.  I remember a few years back when I 
played around with this.  I think I did a zelda theme and a pokemon theme.  
It was quite interesting.  Link was the soldier, a faery was the faery 
(didn't see that one coming did ya?), Ganon was the golem, Zelda was the 
cleric, so on and so forth.  Then in the pokemon version I just put various 
pokemon as the characters.  It took a while to do, esp. the documentation 
part of it (I wanted to write a text document with ALL files in 
"graphics.001" and to where each one was used in the game, that way I could 
COMPLETELY change the theme of Gladiator [even the title screen!])  If anyone 
is interested I will be compelled to find the file on my computer and upload 
that file into the group.

--Triple Threat Topspiner Tristan
